[[Image:self portrait e.jpg|thumb|right|200px|"Self Portrait", oil, 26 x 20, 1973. Collection: [[Newark Museum]]]] ''' Richard Whitney''' ([[1946]]) is an [[United States|American]] painter born in [[New Hampshire]]. Whitney is a [[portrait]] and [[landscape art|landscape]] painter; his paintings currently hang in over 650 fine art collections worldwide.
==Background== Whitney graduated [[Phi Beta Kappa]] from the [[University of New Hampshire]] in 1968. He studied with [[Sidney F. Willis]] and [[R. H. Ives Gammell]]. He has been called "a living master of the classical tradition" by [[Sothebyâs]].
